menu2.name: BSI (Bearer Setting Information)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTBSI is used to configure the GPRS parameters

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Auto (LTE & GSM)|1: GSM Only|3: LTE Only
menu3.Description: Note: “GSM” means EGPRS here

menu2.name: SRI (Server Registration Information)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTSRI is used to configure where and how to report all the messages, including the server information and the communication method between the backend server and the terminal. When the terminal is configured correctly, it should be able to report data to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Stop mode|1: TCP short-connection preferred mode|2: TCP short-connection forced mode|3: TCP long-connection mode|4: UDP mode|5: Forced SMS mode|6: UDP with fixed local port mode|7:Backup server supported TCP long-connection mode|9: MQTT mode |
menu3.Description: This defines the transmission mode between the backend server and unit

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Low priority|2: High priority |
menu3.Description: When enabled, the report messages will be stored to unit memory if no GSM/GPRS/LTE network covering
Maximum 20 characters including the optional national code starting with “+” for SMS messages sending

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Disable|1:Enable SACK And Check|2:Enable SACK But Not check|
menu3.Description: This defines whether the backend server should respond to unit with SACK message when receiving messages from the unit
This defines the format of the report message sent from the device to the backend server
A numeral to indicate the time to maintain TCP connection for receiving commands from the server

menu2.name: QSS (Quick Start Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTQSS is used to configure the GPRS parameters and backend server information if the length of all the settings is no greater than 160 bytes. Otherwise, the two commands AT+GTBSI and AT+GTSRI are used to configure those settings.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Stop mode|1: TCP short-connection preferred mode|2: TCP short-connection forced mode|3: TCP long-connection mode|4: UDP mode|5: Forced SMS mode|6: UDP with fixed local port mode|7: Backup server supported TCP long-connection mode|9:MQTT mode|
menu3.Description: This defines the transmission mode between the backend server and unit

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Low priority |2: High priority|
menu3.Description: When enabled, the report messages will be stored to unit memory if no GSM/GPRS/LTE network covering
Maximum 20 characters including the optional national code starting with “+” for SMS messages sending

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Disable|1:Enable SACK And Check|2:Enable SACK But Not check|
menu3.Description: This defines whether the backend server should respond to unit with SACK message when receiving messages from the unit
This defines the format of the report message sent from the device to the backend server

menu2.name: MQT ( MQTT Server Information)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTMQT is used to configure the username and password to connect to the MQTT server and to subscribe to topics and publish topics, If the terminal is configured correctly, it should be able to report data to the MQTT server.

menu3.Description: Set keep alive mechanism for MOTT
If the mqtt server uses authentication, the user name is specified here
If the mqtt server uses authentication, the password is specified here
Each client connecting to the server has a unique client identifier (ClientID)

menu2.name: MSI (Multi Server Information)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTMSI is used to configure where and how to report all the messages, including the server information and the communication method between the backend server and the terminal. When the terminal is configured correctly, it should be able to report data to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 2:The Data Server of MSI
menu3.Description: The index of the Multi Server

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Stop mode.|2:TCP short-connection forced mode.|3:TCP long-connection mode.|4:UDP mode. |6:UDP with fixed local port.|
menu3.Description: This parameter defines the communication method between the backend server and the terminal

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Disable|1:Enable SACK And Check|2:Enable SACK But Not check|

menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate the time to maintain TCP connection for receiving commands from the server

menu2.name: TLS (TLS Data Encryption)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTTLS is used to configure TLS encryption parameters.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The Data Server of SRI|
0: Disable|1: Enable|
0: Do not verify the certificates|1: Only server certification|2: Two-way certification|
menu3.Description: Specify the certificate verification method for the terminal

menu2.name: OWL (Operator List Configuration)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTOWL is used to configure a white or forbidden list of operators to allow GPRS connection.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: White list Mode|2: Black List Mode|

menu3.Description: The timeout period for the terminal to establish connection to the TCP server

menu2.name: CFG (Global Configuration)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTCFG command is used to configure global parameters.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable the odograph by GNSS|
Speed|Azimuth|Altitude|Cells Information|Mileage|Send Time|Device Name|
0: Disable|1: GNSS Deep Saving Mode|2: GNSS Low Saving Mode|
menu3.Description: Set mode of power saving function

menu3.RangeMx: The number of satellites in view for the current position (GNSS satellite number)|Reserved for indicating <GNSS Trigger Type> (in +RESP:GTFRI and +RESP:GTERI) report which can’t be set here|

menu3.Description: It configures the working mode of Pin 7 on the connector

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Each time the device powers on, all LEDs will work for 30 minutes and then be off|1: All LEDs will be turned on as configured|2: All LEDs will work 10 minutes after the device is powered on and then will be off|
menu3.Description: It configures the working mode of all LEDs

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|

0: Ignore SMS location request.|1: Report the current location(+RESP:GTLBC) to server.|2: Send current location with Google map link to Caller ID via SMS.|&0: Hang up only.|1: Hang up and report the current location (+RESP:GTLBC) to server.|2: Hang up the call and send current location with Google map link to Caller ID via SMS.|3: Both 1 And 2|
menu3.Description: It configures how to handle the incoming call

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
0: Charge On Need|1: Charge After Ignition On|
menu3.Description: It configures how to handle the incoming call

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: AGPS Offline|2: AGPS Online|
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate whether to enable AGPS

menu3.RangeMx: 00: Do not allow the cell information report.|40: Allow the cell information report after failing to get GNSS position if cell information is available.|80: Report the message +RESP:GTGSM after getting GNSS position successfully every time if cell information is available.|C0: Report the message +RESP:GTGSM no matter whether it is successful to get GNSS position if cell information is available.|&+RESP:GTRTL|+RESP:GTLBC|+RESP:GTFRI / +RESP:GTERI|+RESP:GTSOS|+RESP:GTTOW|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|
menu3.Description:
Control how or when to report cells’information
The other bits control whether the following events will trigger the report +RESP:GTGSM
A time parameter to monitor the GNSS signal

menu3.RangeMx: 0: GPS and GLONASS|1: GPS|4: GPS and BeiDou|10:GPS, GLONASS and Galieo positioning systems.|12:GPS, Galieo and Beidou positioning systems.|

menu2.name: DOG (Protocol Watchdog)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTDOG command is used to reboot the device in a time based manner or upon ignition. This helps the device avoid working in an abnormal state for a long time. Besides these two automatic reboot methods, the device also supports the use of the digital input to trigger the reboot manually.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Reboot Periodically| 2: Ignition Reboot|

menu3.Description: If the time interval between two adjacent ignition on events is greater than this value, \n unit will automatically reboot when ignition on
The time interval for rebooting the device
The time clock to perform the reboot operation after 'Interval' is met

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|

menu3.Description: ID of the digital input port which is used to trigger the manually reboot in despite of working mode
The interval for rebooting the device when there is no network signal. 0 means “Do not reboot the device
The interval for rebooting the device when the device is unable to be registered to the EGPRS/LTE network. 0 means “Do not reboot the device
The length of time (in minutes) before rebooting the device when the device fails to send a message. 0 means “Do not reboot the device

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Reboot device|1: Reboot RF-Radio Frequency, only valid for <No Network Interval>, <No Activation Interval> and <Send Failure Timeout>|
menu3.Description: It is used to set the category that needs to be rebooted
The time interval in minutes for rebooting the device when the device cannot receive CANBUS messages from CAN100

menu2.name: GAM (GNSS-Assisted Motion)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTGAM is used for assisting in measuring motion with GNSS if the sensor detects stationary state while the vehicle is ignition on.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the GNSS-assisted motion measurement function

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: Enable/disable the use of GNSS speed to assist with motion status measurement based on motion sensor state
The speed threshold which is combined with GNSS speed to measure the status of movement
If the average speed is higher than <Motion Speed Threshold> for <Motion Cumulative Time>, the device is considered to be in moving state
If the average speed is lower than <Motion Speed Threshold> for <Motionless Cumulative Time>, the device is considered to be in stationary state
If the time of GNSS fix is more than <GNSS Fix Failure Timeout>, the device will update motion status by motion sensor

menu2.name: HMC (Hour Meter Count)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTHMC is used to measure the accumulated use time of the device with each actuation of ignition on. To use this command, the ignition signal must be connected to the device.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable the hour meter count function.|1: Difference Calculation Mode.|2: Initial Value Mode.

menu2.name: HRM (Hex Report Mask)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTHRM command is used to control the composition of the corresponding HEX report message. In each HEX report message, the corresponding mask for the report indicates which part is reported.

menu2.name: OWH (Outside Working Hours)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTOWH is used to define the working hours and the working mode to protect the privacy.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Manual Mode|2: Full Manual Mode|3: Automatic Mode|

menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to specify the working days in a week

menu2.name: PDS (Preserving Device's States)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTPDS is used to preserve specified logic states for the device. The function works according to the <Mode> setting, and the logic state(s) to be saved are selected according to the value of <Mask>.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Save Logical States|2: Reset Logical States|

0: State of GEO|1: Reserved|2: Reserved|3: Information of last known position|4: State of ignition|5: State of wave shape 1|6: State of digital input|7: State of SPD|8: State of SSR|9: State of main power|10: State of PEO|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to configure which device states will be preserved.Each bit represents a state

menu2.name: PIN (Auto-unlock PIN)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTPIN is used to configure the auto-unlock PIN function of the device.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|

menu2.name: TMA (Time Adjustment)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTTMA is used to adjust for the local time of the device remotely. Upon receiving this command, the device will set the time zone and daylight saving accordingly. Then it will use the given UTC time to adjust for the local time based on the time zone and daylight saving setting.

menu3.Description: Indicate the positive or negative of the local time offset to UTC
UTC time used to adjust local time

menu2.name: WLT (Allowlist)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTWLT is used to configure a list of authorized phone numbers which are allowed to perform the SMS functions.

menu3.RangeMx: Bit0: White list for location by call.|Bit1: Reserved.|Bit2: White list for SMS.|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to configure the white list

menu2.name: AVS (Accelerometer Virtual Ignition)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTAVS is used to configure parameters for detecting virtual ignition status based on motion status. It works when hard-wired ignition line is not connected and Accelerometer (motion status) virtual ignition mode is enabled by AT+GTVMS.

menu3.Description: A time parameter to determine whether the device enters stationary state
A time parameter to determine whether the device enters moving state

menu2.name: VVS (Voltage Virtual Ignition)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTVVS is used to configure parameters for checking ignition state by voltage. It will work when hard-wired ignition line is not connected and Voltage Virtual Ignition mode is enabled by AT+GTVMS.

menu3.Description: The external power voltage in ignition on state
The offset from <Ignition On Voltage> used to determine ignition on or ignition off state
The debounce time before updating virtual ignition state according to the external power voltage

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: The debounce time to wait before updating the virtual ignition off state according to the external power voltage
Enable/disable smart voltage adjustment algorithm

menu2.name: VMS (Virtual Ignition Mode Selection)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTVMS is used to configure the mode of virtual ignition state detection.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|2: Voltage virtual ignition detection mode. |4: Accelerometer virtual ignition detection mode|7: Combined detection mode. |
menu3.Description: A numeral to define the working mode of virtual ignition state detection

menu3.RangeMx: Bit0 (01): Voltage virtual ignition detection|Bit1 (02): Motion status virtual ignition detection|
Bit0 (01): Voltage virtual ignition detection|Bit1 (02): Motion status virtual ignition detection|
0: AND logic.|1: OR logic.|
menu3.Description: The logic of each bit in <Virtual Ignition On Mask>.

menu2.name: CMD (Command String Storage)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTCMD command is used to store the commands which will be used by the command AT+GTUDF.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Delete command.|1: Add command.|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the store command string
A numeric to identify the stored command
the whole content of the stored command

menu2.name: UDF (User Defined Function)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTUDF command is used to bind input events and stored commands. The input events will trigger the corresponding stored commands.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable The Event Group.|1: Enable The Event Group|2: Delete The Event Group|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the user defined fuction
A numeric to identify the group of input events and stored commands to execute

menu2.name: ASC (Axis Self-Calibration)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTASC is used to define the condition for calibrating the directions of accelerometer. When the auto self-calibration factors updated, the device will report the event message +RESP:GTASC which includes the calibration result to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Enable.|

menu2.name: BTS (Bluetooth Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTBTS is used to configure Bluetooth settings for the device to report certain events.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
0: Non-discoverable mode|1: General Discoverable After Igintion On|2:General Discoverable After Igintion Off|3:General Discoverable After Power On|
menu3.Description: The mode to configure the Bluetooth to be non-discoverable or discoverable for the period according to (Discoverable Time)
Time period for the device to remain discoverable

menu3.RangeMx: Bluetooth Name|Bluetooth MAC Address|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Peer Role|Reserved|Peer Address Type|Peer MAC Address|
0: Disable|1: Enable|
CCCD : Client Characteristic Configuration Descriptor – UUID : 0x2902|

menu3.Description: Frequency of scanning
The duration of each scan

menu2.name: BAS (Bluetooth Accessory)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTBAS is used for the device to scan or connect with Bluetooth accessories in order to obtain data such as humidity, temperature or fuel level. To use this command, the parameter <Mode> in the command AT+GTBTS must be enabled.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: No Bluetooth accessory|1: Escort Bluetooth Accessory|2: Beacon temperature sensor|4: CAN accessory|6: Beacon Multi-Functional Sensorr|7: Technoton accessory|8: External Input Output Bluetooth Accessory|10: Mechatronics Bluetooth accessory|11: Magnet Bluetooth accessory|12: BLE TPMS sensor|13: Relay Bluetooth accessory|14: Smart Cap Bluetooth accessory|
menu3.Description: The type of the Bluetooth accessory which is selected in the Index
The model of the Bluetooth accessory which is selected in the <Accessory Type>.

menu3.RangeMx: Accessory Name|Accessory MAC|Accessory Status|Accessory Battery Level|Accessory Temperature|Accessory Humidity|Reserved|Accessory Input Output Data|Accessory Event Notification Data|Tire pressure|Time stamp|Enhanced Temperature|Magnet Data|Accessory Battery Percentage|Relay Data|

menu3.Description: The interval for reading data from Bluetooth accessory
Specify the lower limit voltage. When the voltage of Bluetooth accessary is below this value, the device will report message +RESP:GTBAA to backend server

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable event notification.|1: Enable event notification.|
menu3.Description: It configures whether to enable event notification function

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Report temperature alarm within the temperature range.|2: Report temperature alarm outside the temperature range .|3: Report temperature alarm only once enters or exits the temperature range. |
menu3.Description: The working mode of the temperature alarm
If the sensor detects the environment temperature which meets the alarm condition, it will continuously check the temperature
the device will report temperature alarm every this times of temperature reading
the code needs to be input when paired with accessories

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Report temperature alarm within the temperature range.|2: Report temperature alarm outside the temperature range .|3: Report temperature alarm only once enters or exits the temperature range. |
menu3.Description: The working mode of the temperature alarm
If the sensor detects the environment temperature which meets the alarm condition, it will continuously check the temperature
the device will report temperature alarm every this times of temperature reading

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Report humidity alarm within the humidity range.|2: Report humidity alarm outside the humidity range.|3: Report humidity alarm only once enters or exits the humidity range. |
menu3.Description: The working mode of the humidity alarm
If the sensor detects the humidity in surrounding environment meets the alarm condition, it will continuously check the humidity
the device will report Humidity alarm every this times of Humidity reading
The time interval for sending the +RESP:GTBAR report message to the backend server when the ignition is on
The time interval for sending the +RESP:GTBAR report message to the backend server when the ignition is off
The actual length of sensor after cutting
The frequency of empty sensor (not immersed in fuel)
The frequency of sensor fully immersed in fuel

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The original value of fuel level.|1: The percentage of fuel level.|
menu3.Description: The format of fuel level in the message

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: It configures whether to enable event notification function

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Report tire pressure alarm within the tire pressure range.|2: Report tire pressure alarm outside the tire pressure range.|3: Report tire pressure alarm only once enters/exits the tire pressure range. |
menu3.Description: The working mode of the tire pressure alarm
If the tire pressure keeps meeting the alarm condition for <Validity> times, the tire pressure alarm will be triggered
After the <Validity> checking, the device will report tire pressure alarm every <Send Interval> times of tire pressure reading based on reading timer of tire pressure sensor
If the device do not detect the tire pressure sensor in the <Available Validity Time>, the <Accessory Status> in the message +RESP:GTERI report messages will be 0

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Enable.|
menu3.Description: It configures whether to enable event notification function

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Report temperature alarm within the temperature range.|2: Report temperature alarm outside the temperature range .|3: Report temperature alarm only once enters or exits the temperature range. |
menu3.Description: The working mode of the temperature alarm
If the sensor detects the environment temperature which meets the alarm condition, it will continuously check the temperature
the device will report temperature alarm every this times of temperature reading

menu2.name: BID (Bluetooth Beacon ID)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTBID is used for the device to scan Bluetooth beacon accessories. To use this function, the parameter <Mode> in the command AT+GTBTS must be 1.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
0: WKF300|1: iBeacon E6|2: ID ELA|4: WID310|
Reserved|Accessory MAC|Reserved|Accessory Battery Level, iBeacon E6 is not supported|Reserved|Reserved|Signal Strength|Beacon Type and Beacon Data|

menu3.Description: It specifies the lower voltage limit

menu3.RangeMx: 0:No push the WKF300|1:Push the WKF300|
menu3.Description: If this parameter is set to 1 and the button on WKF300 is pushed, the device will report the message +RESP:GTBAA to backend server

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Allow the device to scan only once. |2: After entering ignition on and moving state, the device will keep scanning Keyfobs continuously.|4: Allow the device to scan continuously.|

menu3.Description: The device scans Keyfobs for the time period specified by this parameter when <Keyfob Detection Mode> is 1

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Allow the device to scan only once.|2: Allow the device to scan continuously. |

menu3.Description: The device scans E6 for the time period specified by this parameter

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable alarm.|1: Alarm when receiving Bluetooth broadcast.|2: Alarm when Bluetooth broadcast is not received.|3: Alarm when receiving Bluetooth broadcast or leaving Bluetooth broadcast.|
menu3.Description: It specifies the mode of detecting ID ELA

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Allow the device to scan only once.|2: After entering ignition on and moving state, the device will keep scanning IDELA continuously.|3: Allow the device to scan continuously.|

menu3.Description: The device scans IDELA for the time period specified by this parameter

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|2: After entering ignition-on-and-moving state, the device will keep scanning WID310 continuously. |3: Allow the device to scan continuously. |

menu3.Description: The device scans WID310 for the time period specified by this parameter when <WID310 Detection Mode> is 2
It is the first three bytes of Bluetooth address, which is composed of NAP and UAP

menu2.name: AEX (Analog Input Expansion)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTAEX is used to configure the parameters of External Bluetooth Analog Input accessories. All these inputs are customizable.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Bluetooth Analog Input accessory setting|
menu3.Description: It’s used to indicate which extended device the following parameters are used for
It is used to bind the specific configuration in AT+GTBAS

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable Analog Input Alarm Within The Range|2: Enable Analog Input Alarm Outside The Range|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the analog input alarm (+RESP:GTAIS)

menu2.name: SVR (Stolen Vehicle Recovery)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTSVR is used to configure the Bluetooth settings for the Primary device. If the Primary device does not successfully communicate with the Ghost device within the time defined by <Connect Interval> x <Connect Fail Count>, it will report the message +RESP:GTSVR to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Enable.|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the Primary device’s stolen vehicle recovery function
The MAC address of the Ghost device which is used to pair with the Primary device
The maximum amount of time allowed for the Ghost device to establish a connection withthe Primary device
The maximum number of connection failures between the Primary device and the Ghost device
The IMEI of the Ghost device which is used to match withthe Primary device
It specifies the interval for reporting the+RESP:GTBTImessage regarding the status and Bluetooth information of the Ghost device

menu2.name: FRI (Fixed Report Information)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTFRI is used to configure the parameters for fixed report FRI or ERI.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Fixed Time Report.|2: Fixed Distance Report. |3: Fixed Mileage Report. |4: Optimum Report.|5: Fixed Time or Mileage Report.|
menu3.Description: The working mode of fixed report

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Enable report.|1:Disable report.

menu3.Description: The interval time to update GNSS position
Timed cycle to send report to the backend server
The amount of space between two places.\nThe specified distance if unit passed every time, it will send the position information
Mileage is the total of distance.\nThe specified mileage if unit passed every time, it will send the position information
The threshold to determine whether unit is turning around a corner
Period to fix and send the position information when ignition off and Power Saving Mode is set to 0 or 2

menu3.RangeMx: Reserved|1-Wire Data|CAN Data|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Bluetooth Accessory Data|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|RAT and Band Data|Reserved|IGN Trigger Data|Card ID
menu3.Description: Used to configure whether to report the data from peripherals by +RESP:GTERI

After the ignition is turned off, the +RESP:GTFRI/ +RESP:GTERI message will continue to be reported according to<Send Interval>for an extra period of time specified by <Continue Time>, and then will be reported according to <IGF Report Interval&gt

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Do not wrap corner point|1: Wrap corner point and wait|
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate whether to wrap corner point together with other fixed GNSS points and wait until the condition to send +RESP:GTFRI reaches according to the value of <Mode&gt

menu2.name: FFC (Frequency Change of FRI)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTFFC is used to change the parameters of fixed report when a certain event occurs, so that different report interval requirements can be met. When the event disappears, the device will resume its previous settings.

menu3.Description: Priority to the event which triggers the parameter change for fixed report. 0 is the highest priority

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Change FRI parameters By Geo-Fence Alarm|2: Change FRI parameters By Know Roaming Alarm|3: Change FRI parameters By Unknow Roaming Alarm|
menu3.Description: Specify the trigger event to change the fixed report parameters

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Disable|1: Fixed Time Report|2: Fixed Distance Report|3: Fixed Mileage Report|4: Optimum Report|5: Fixed Time or Mileage Report|
menu3.Description: When the specified event occurs, the working mode of the fixed report will be changed according to this parameter
Period to send the position information when ignition is on
The specified distance to send the position information when change to fixed distance report
The specified path length to send the position information when change to fixed mileage report or optimum report
The time interval for sending the position information when the ignition is on
The time interval for GNSS fix
The threshold to determine whether the device is turning around a corner

menu2.name: CRA (Crash Detection)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTCRA is used to configure the parameters for crash detection.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable Detection Of Crash With Three-Axis|2: Enable Detection Of Crash With Self-calibration Three-Axis|
0: Start Sampling After power on|1: Start Sampling After ignition on|
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate when to start acceleration sampling
Pick out all day of work The number of XYZ-axis acceleration samples recorded before crash
The number of XYZ-axis acceleration samples recorded after crash

menu2.name: BZA (Buzzer Alarm)
menu2.Description2: This command is used to set buzzer alarm. There are four kinds of alarms. Each alarm outputs a different sound with the buzzer, and all the alarms are settable in this command. Before those alarms are used, the output ID which connects with the buzzer should be configured and enabled.

menu2.name: GEO (Geo-Fence)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTGEO is used to configure the parameters of circular Geo-Fence. Circular Geo-Fence is a virtual perimeter around a geographic area using a location-based service. When the geo fencing terminal enters or exits the area, a notification is generated. .

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Entering the zone|2: Exiting the zone|3: Both entering and exiting|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the Geo-Fence alarm
The longitude of a point which is defined as the center of the Geo-Fence circular region
The latitude of a point which is defined as the center of the Geo-Fence circular region
The radius of the Geo-Fence circular region
The interval of GNSS checking for the Geo-Fence alarm

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|21: Auto Mode|22: Manual Mode|
menu3.Description: The Trigger mode of the Geo-Fence alarm

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: Whether to report +RESP:GTGES message when the specified trigger mode is triggered and when the Geo-Fence is cancelled
Start to monitor the device that enters the geo-fence or departs from the geo-fence
End monitoring the device that enters the geo-fence or departs from the geo-fence

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Ignore State Change|1: Need State Change|
menu3.Description: The mode of state reporting

menu2.name: PEO (Polygon Geo-Fence)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTPEO is used to configure the parameters of Polygon Geo-Fence. Geo-Fence is a virtual perimeter around a geographic area using a location-based service. When the geo-fencing terminal enters or exits the area, a notification is generated.

menu3.Description: ID of the Geo-Fence

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Entering the zone|2: Exiting the zone|3: Both entering and exiting|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the Geo-Fence alarm
The interval of GNSS checking for the Geo-Fence alarm

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Report when getting the PEO state for the first time.|1: Do not report until the PEO state changes.
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate the mode of reporting PEO state

menu2.name: HBM (Harsh Behavior Monitoring)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTHBM is used to monitor the harsh driving behavior based on GNSS or motion sensor.The same harsh behavior within 30 seconds will only be reported once if only GNSS is used to measure harsh driving behavior.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Detected by GNSS only|2: Detected by motion sensor only|3: Detected by motion sensor or GNSS|4: Detected by motion sensor and GNSS|5: Detected by XYZ-axis acceleration data only|

menu3.Description: The speed changes within Behavior Duration

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Not Discard Unknow Alarm|1: Discard Unknow Alarm|
menu3.Description: It configures whether to discard the +RESP:GTHBM message that indicates unknown harsh behavior
If the last known speed of unit read from GNSS is greater or equal to <High Speed>, \nthe vehicle that the terminal is attached to is considered to be high speed
The threshold for harsh braking in high speed level
The threshold for harsh acceleration in high speed level
If the last known speed is less than 'High Speed' while greater or equal to <Medium Speed>, \nthe vehicle is considered to be medium speed
The threshold for harsh braking in medium speed level
The threshold for harsh acceleration in medium speed level
The threshold for harsh braking in low speed level
The threshold for harsh acceleration in low speed level
The threshold for the motion sensor to measure whether the device is in harsh turn or harsh break status
The time parameter to confirm that the device enters harsh turn or harsh break status
The threshold for the motion sensor to measure whether the device is in harsh accelerate behavior status
The time parameter to confirm that the device enters harsh accelerate status
The threshold for the 3-axial acceleration data measure whether the device is in harsh braking status
The time parameter to measure whether the device enters harsh braking status

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Only Report HBM Alarm|1: Report HBE and HBM Alarm|2: Only Report HBE Alarm|

menu2.name: IDL (Excessive Idling Detection)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTIDL is used to detect the engine excessive idling (vehicle stays stationary while ignition is on). To use this command, the ignition signal must be connected to the device. If the vehicle is entering into/leaves the idle status, the device will report the event message IDN/IDF to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|

menu3.Description: If the vehicle is detected to be stationary with ignition on for this time long, it is considered to be in idling status
The time of the vehicle is considered to leave idling status
If the vehicle moves a longer distance than <Debounce Distance> after it enters into idling status, the vehicle will be considered to leave idling status

menu2.name: JDC (Jamming Detection)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTJDC is used to configure the parameters for jamming detection. When the detection condition is matched, the device will report the event message JDR/JDS to the backend server according to the <Mode> setting.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Report the alarm message upon entering into jamming state.|2: Report the alarm message upon entering into jamming state or quitting jamming state.|

menu3.Description: The built-in LTE jamming detection algorithm uses these two parameters to measure whether the device is currently being jammed
The smaller the parameter value, the more sensitive the detection will be
The built-in 2G jamming detection algorithm uses these two parameters to measure whether the device is currently being jammed
The smaller the parameter value, the more sensitive the detection will be
when the device detects the jamming, the device based on this parameter to trigger the enter Jamming event
when the device quits the jamming, the device based on this parameter to trigger the quit Jamming event

menu2.name: RMD (Roaming Detection)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTRMD is used to configure the parameters for roaming detection.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|

menu2.name: SOS (SOS Setting)
menu2.Description2: This command is used to configure a specified input port for emergency. When an emergency occurs, the end user can use the specified input port to trigger the emergency call and report the position message SOS to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|2: Send the current position to the backend server only|4: Send the current position to the SMS gateway via SMS|

menu3.Description: ID of the digital input port which triggers the SOS function

menu3.RangeMx: 1: Send The Current GNSS Location|2: Send The Last GNSS Location|3: Both Mode 1 And 2|
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate the type of the GNSS position

menu2.name: SPA (Overspeed Alarm)
menu2.Description2: This command is used to set the speed thresholds and bind one alarm type with each speed threshold for the buzzer alarm. If the current speed meets one of the thresholds, the buzzer will make a sound corresponding to the alarm type.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Strict Standard Mode|2: Warning mode|

menu3.Description: If the speed meets the alarm condition and maintains a period of time defined by Validity, the buzzer alarm will be triggered
The alarm type for each speed threshold, 0 means no buzzer alarm

menu2.name: SPD (Speed Alarm)
menu2.Description2: This command is used to set a speed range for the speed alarm function of the terminal. According to the working mode, the terminal could report the message SPD to the backend server when its moving speed is outside or inside the range.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable speed alarm|1: Alarm in speed range|2: Alarm out of speed range|3: Report Speed Alarm Only once if the current speed enters or exits the speed range|

menu3.Description: A period of time that the speed meets and maintains in the alarm condition
The interval of sending speed alarm message if unit maintains in the alarm condition

menu2.name: SSR (Start/Stop Report)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTSSR is used to detect the status of vehicle (Start/Stop status). When it is detected by the device that the vehicle is entering into Start/Stop status, the device will report the event message STR/STP to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|

menu3.Description: After the vehicle enters into start status, if it rest again and keeps in that status for this time long, \nthe vehicle is considered to leave start status
If the vehicle is detected to be moving with ignition on for this time long, it is considered to be in start status
The start speed threshold to determine whether the vehicle is start or not
After the vehicle enters into stop status and stay stop for this time long

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Minute|1: Second|
menu3.Description: It controls the time unit of <Time to Stop> and <Time to Start> parameters

menu3.RangeMx: 0:The event message +RESP:GTSTP will be reported when the engine is turned off and the time meets the parameter <Time to Stop>.|1:The event message +RESP:GTSTP will be reported immediately when the engine is turned off, it only works when <Mode> is set to 1.|
menu3.Description: Whether to report STP message immediately when the engine is turned off.

menu2.name: Tow (Tow Alarm)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTTOW command is used to configure the tow alarm parameters.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|

menu3.Description: A duration threshold to judge whether the moving terminal is considered being towed after its engine off
A duration threshold to judge whether unit with engine off is in fake tow after it changes to move from stillness.
A duration threshold to judge whether unit enters stillness status
A duration threshold to judge whether unit enters motion status
The threshold for on-board motion sensor to judge whether unit is moving
A distance parameter to determine whether the device is considered to be towed after the engine is turned off

menu2.name: AIS (Analog Input Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTAIS is used to configure the parameters of analog input ports.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable Alarm Within The Range|2: Enable Alarm Outside The Range|
0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: The device can send the analog input voltage periodically along with fixed report message. Set this field to 1 to enable it, 0 to disable

This parameter will use with <Min Threshold> and <Max Threshold> parameters together,it express that the voltage margin error of the <Min Threshold> and <Max Threshold> parameters, if the current value of voltage detection include in the voltage margin error of the min and max threshold, this voltage value will not be processed

menu2.name: DIS (Digital Input Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTDIS is used to configure the parameters of 3 digital input ports. The input <Ignition Detection> is dedicated to ignition detection. The other two inputs are customizable. If the logic status is changed on one of the two digital input ports, the device will report the message DIS to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:The ID of the ignition detection port|
0: Disable|1: Enable|

menu3.Description: The validity time of the input port, 0 means not to check the validity time

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|

menu3.Description: The validity time of the input port, 0 means not to check the validity time

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Send Real Time Position|1: Send Last Know Position|
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate whether to include real time position or last known position in the report +RESP:GTDIS

menu2.name: DOS (Digital Output Setting)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTDOS command is used to output specified wave shape from the digital output ports. A total of four wave shapes are supported as shown below. If set to wave shape 1, the device will maintain this wave shape at the specified output port after power reset.

menu3.Description: A numerical to indicate the version of this command
The number of output ports which are going to be set

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable status.|1: Enable status|2: Gradual-progressive-wave-shape Enable status|

menu3.Description: The long operation time for output1

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable status.|1: Enable status|2: Gradual-progressive-wave-shape Enable status|

menu3.Description: The long operation time for output2

menu3.RangeMx: For output 1 (not) to report +RESP:GTDOS|For output 2 (not) to report +RESP:GTDOS|

menu3.Description: Digital output will not be triggered when GNSS speed is over the set speed. The unit is km/h
If the speed is lower than <Overspeed Restrict Output> for the length of time specified by <Debounce Time>, AT+GTDOS will be executed

menu2.name: EPS (External Power Monitoring)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTEPS is used to configure the parameters for external power supply monitoring. The device will measure and monitor the voltage of the external power supply. If the voltage of the external power supply meets the predefined alarm condition, the device will report an alarm message EPS to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable |1: Report when the input voltage in the range|2: Report when the input voltage outside the range|
menu3.Description: Working mode of the external power supply monitoring
The sampling period to measure the external power supply
The time for debouncing to avoid exceptional voltage drop of the external power supply

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Do not report external power supply voltage|1: Report external power supply voltage|
menu3.Description: Besides the +RESP:GTEPS alarm report, the device can also send the voltage of external power supply periodically along with the fixed report message

This parameter will use with <Min Threshold> and <Max Threshold> parameters together,it express that the voltage margin error of the <Min Threshold> and <Max Threshold> parameters, if the current value of voltage detection include in the voltage margin error of the min and max threshold, this voltage value will not be processed

This parameter will be used with <Debounce Time> together, if the voltage drops or bursts exceptionally greater than <Debounce Voltage Threshold>, the device will start to debounce voltage by <Debounce Time&gt
The validity time of detecting the device connecting or disconnecting main power supply, 0 means not to check the validity time

menu2.name: GDO (Gradual Digital Output)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTGDO command is used to configure specified gradual progressive wave shape from the digital output ports.

menu3.Description: Time (in units of 100ms) that the output will be in active state, during the first cycle
Time (in units of 100ms) that forms a complete cycle (ON phase time + OFF phase time)
Time (in units of 100ms) that shall be added to the ON phase time, before starting the next cycle. If this time is 0, the cycles are kept equal

menu2.name: IOB (Input/Output Port Binding)
menu2.Description2: This command is used to configure the user defined output port actions triggered by input port. If the I/O binding is configured and the corresponding condition is met, the device will output specified wave shape on the specified output port.

menu3.Description: The IO binding ID for user to define

menu3.RangeMx: Ignition detection|Digital input 1|Digital input 2|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Digital input 6|Reserved|EIO100 input 9|EIO100 input A|EIO100 input B|EIO100 input C|
Ignition detection|Digital input 1|Digital input 2|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Digital input 6|Reserved|EIO100 input 9|EIO100 input A|EIO100 input B|EIO100 input C|

menu3.Description: The sampling interval for checking the status of the digital input port in one IO binding

menu2.name: IGM (Ignition Multiplexing Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTIGM is used to make the ignition input available as a digital input. If the logic status of the digital input port changes, the device will report the message +RESP:GTDIS to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable the message DIS report.|1: Activate the digital input.|2: Deactivate the digital input.|3: Both upon activating and deactivating the digital input.|
0: Disable count the number of times.|1: Activate the digital input.|2: Deactivate the digital input.
menu3.Description: Counting the times of the input that has been triggered. The number of times will be displayed in the parameter <IGN Trigger Data> of the +RESP:GTERI message.

menu2.name: CAN (Canbus Setting)
menu2.Description2: This command AT+GTCAN is used to set the CANBUS device configuration for reporting CANBUS device information.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|

menu3.Description: Period to send +RESP: GTCAN report message to the backend server when ignition on
Period to send +RESP: GTCAN report message to the backend server when ignition off

menu3.RangeMx: VIN|Ignition Key|Total Distance|Total Fuel Used|Vehicle Speed|Engine RPM|Engine Coolant Temperature|Fuel Consumption|Fuel Level|Range|Accelerator Pedal Pressure|Total Engine Hours|Total Driving Time|Total Engine Idle Time|Total Idle Fuel Used|Axle Weight 2nd|Tachograph Information|Detailed Information / Indicators|Lights|Doors|Total Vehicle Overspeed Time|Total Vehicle Engine Overspeed Time|Total Distance Impulses|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Electric Report Mask|CAN Report Expansion Mask|GNSS Information|GSM Information|
By ignition on/off event|
menu3.Description: Whether to send the report message +RESP:GTCAN by additional event

menu3.RangeMx: Ad-Blue Level|Axle Weight 1st|Axle Weight 3rd|Axle Weight 4th|Tachograph Overspeed Signal|Tachograph Vehicle Motion Signal|Tachograph Driving Direction|Analog Input Value|Engine Braking Factor|Pedal Braking Factor|Total Accelerator Kick-downs|Total Effective Engine Speed Time|Total Cruise Control Time|Total Accelerator Kick-down Time|Total Brake Applications|Tachograph Driver 1 Card Number|Tachograph Driver 2 Card Number|Tachograph Driver 1 Name|Tachograph Driver 2 Name|Registration Number|Expansion Information|Rapid Brakings|Rapid Accelerations|Engine Torque|Service Distance|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|DTC Codes|
0: Disable this function.|1: Enable this function.|
menu3.Description: It specifies whether to use GNSS to calculate total distance when the communication between the device and CAN Chipset is abnormal

menu3.RangeMx: Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Battery Level|Reserved|Reserved|Battery Charging Current|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Battery Charging Remaining Time|

menu2.name: CLT (Canbus Alarm Setting)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTCLT command is used to set alarm threshold of CANBUS data.

menu3.Description: The ID of the CANBUS alarm group

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable the CAN alarm function.|1: Enable the CAN alarm function.|
menu3.Description: The CANBUS alarm working mode for each group
The time for CANBUS alarm trigger event debouncing

menu3.RangeMx: VIN|Ignition Key|Total Distance|Total Fuel Used|Vehicle Speed|Engine RPM|Engine Coolant Temperature|Fuel Consumption|Fuel Level|Range|Accelerator Pedal Pressure|Total Engine Hours|Total Driving Time|Total Engine Idle Time|Total Idle Fuel Used|Axle Weight 2nd|Tachograph Information|Detailed Information/Indicators|Lights|Doors|Total Vehicle Overspeed Time|Total Vehicle Engine Overspeed Time|Total Distance Impulses|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|CAN Report Expansion Mask|

FL – fuel low indicator |DS – driver seatbelt indicator|AC – air conditioning|CC – cruise control |B – brake pedal |C – clutch pedal |H – handbrake|CL – central lock|R – reverse gear|RL – running lights|LB – low beams |HB – high beams |RFL – rear fog lights |FFL – front fog lights |D – doors |T – trunk |W – webcast |BFL – brake fluid low indicator |CLL – coolant level low indicator |BAT– battery indicator|BF – brake system failure indicator|OP – oil pressure indicator|EH – engine hot indicator|ABS – ABS failure indicator|Reserved|CHK –“check engine” indicator|AIR – airbags indicator|SC – service call indicator|OLL – oil level low indicator|

Running Lights|Low Beam|High Beam|Front Fog Light|Rear Fog Light |Hazard Lights|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Driver Door|Passenger Door |Rear Left Door |Rear Right Door|Trunk |Hood|

Under Low RPM Event |Over Low RPM Event |Under High RPM Event |Over High RPM Event |Under Vehicle Speed Low Threshold Event |Over Vehicle Speed Low Threshold Event |Under Vehicle Speed High Threshold Event |Over Vehicle Speed High Threshold Event|

menu3.Description: This is the threshold of the high engine RPM
This is the threshold of the low engine RPM

menu3.RangeMx: Ad-Blue Level|Axle Weight 1st|Axle Weight 3rd|Axle Weight 4th|Tachograph Overspeed Signal|Tachograph Vehicle Motion Signal|Tachograph Driving Direction|Analog Input Value|Engine Braking Factor|Pedal Braking Factor|Total Accelerator Kick-downs|Total Effective Engine Speed Time|Total Cruise Control Time|Total Accelerator Kick-down Time|Total Brake Applications|Tachograph Driver 1 Card Number|Tachograph Driver 2 Card Number|Tachograph Driver 1 Name|Tachograph Driver 2 Name|Registration Number|Expansion Information|Rapid Brakings|Rapid Accelerations|Engine Torque|

menu3.Description: This parameter is for high threshold of CANBUS speed alarm
This parameter is for low threshold of CANBUS speed alarm

menu2.name: CFU (CAN FOTA Upgrade)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTCFU is used to upgrade the firmware in CAN Module over the air.

menu3.Description: It specifies the maximum number of times of retries to download the update package upon download failure
It specifies the expiration timeout of one single downloading

menu3.RangeMx: 0: HTTP|

menu3.Description: If the file server uses authentication, the user name is specified here
If the file server uses authentication, the password is specified here

menu3.RangeMx: 0: CAN Module Firmware|1: CAN Module configuration |
menu3.Description: 0:Update the firmware of CAN Module. 1:Update the configuration of CAN Module

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Start Upgrade.|1: Cancel Upgrade.|
menu3.Description: 0 or empty: Start CAN Module upgrade procedure. 1: Cancel CAN Module upgrade procedure

menu2.name: ACD (1-Wire Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTACD is used to configure the parameters of 1-wire devices which include iButton/DR200, temperature sensors and humidity sensors.

menu3.Description: Interval of search the ID Read Timer
The interval for reading the 1-wire sensor data

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disconnect.|1: Connected.|
Bit 0: Temperature data.|Bit 1: Humidity data.|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to control the composition of data types read by <Data Read Timer&gt

menu2.name: UDT (User-defined Data Transfer)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTUDT is used to transfer user-defined data to the destination specified by <Mode>. User-defined data is transferred in the +RESP:GTUDT message format.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable data transmission|2: Enable data transmission over Bluetooth|

menu3.Description: Period to send the related information when the ignition is on

menu3.RangeMx: Protocol Version, Firmware Version|Hardware Version|Unique ID|Device Name| Speed|Azimuth|Altitude|Cells information，Position Append Mask|Mileage|HMC|GSV|GEO State|Analog Input|Digital Input, Digital output, Motion Status|External Power VCC, Backup Battery Level, Charging|GEO Status Mask|PEO State|PEO Status Mask|Reserved|Send Time|

menu2.name: IEX (Input Expansion)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTIEX is used to configure the parameters of external Bluetooth Input accessories. All these inputs are customizable. If the logic status is changed on one of Bluetooth Input accessories, the device will report the message +RESP:GTDIS to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: EIO100 Setting.|1: Bluetooth Accessory Input Setting.|
menu3.Description: It’s used to indicate which extended device the following parameters are used for
It is used to bind the specific configuration in AT+GTBAS when the <Input Expansion Type>is set to 1.
The total number of configured EIO100 inputs.

menu2.name: OEX (Output Expansion)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTOEX is used to change the Bluetooth Output accessory status.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: EIO100 Setting.|1: Bluetooth Accessory Input Setting.|
menu3.Description: It indicates what kind of extended device the following parameters can be used for
The total number of configured EIO100 outputs.

menu3.RangeMx: Output 9 |Output A |Output B|Output C|

menu2.name: IDA (ID Authentication)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTIDA is used to protect against unauthorized use. This is achieved through an ID card reader for driver identification, and connecting an external relay (normally closed relay recommended) to cut off the starter or the fuel pump.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Only authorized ID cards can unlock the vehicle.|2: Any ID card can unlock the vehicle.|4: Any ID Unlock with Single Reporting.

menu3.Description: when the ignition off, it still be authorized for a little time. In this period, you don’t need the authentication

menu3.RangeMx: Report the ID which is authorized.|Report the ID which is unauthorized.|Report the ID which has logged out.|
menu3.Description: The mode of reporting ID
It will remain authorized for this period of time when the ID is validity

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Report the latest RFID number Immediately|1: Report the latest RFID number Under Ignition On and Authorization|
0: IDA Number List|1: MAC List|
menu3.Description: This parameter indicates which ID List to use

menu2.name: TMP (Temperature Alarm)
menu2.Description2: This command is used to set a temperature-alarm range for the terminal. According to the working mode, the terminal will report the event message TMP to the backend server when the temperature outside or inside the range is detected by the device.

menu3.Description: ID of the temperature alarm

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable the Alarm within the temperature range|2: Enable the Alarm Outside the temperature range|3: Enable the Alarm within or outside the temperature range, But Report only once|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the temperature alarm
ID of the temperature sensor
When the temperature sensor detects the environment temperature meets the alarm condition, it will continuously check the temperature this times
the device will report temperature alarm every this times of temperature reading

menu2.name: DAT (Transparent Data)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTDAT is used to transfer data between the backend server and an external device connected to the Bluetooth of the device.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Short Format|2: Long Format|4: Send data directly to the Bluetooth|5: Send data directly to the Bluetooth without CRLF|
menu3.Description: Command type to indicate the direction to transferring data
Data to be transferred between the backend server and the external device connected to the Bluetooth of the device

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Do not need the ACK report|1: Need the ACK report|
menu3.Description: Need report‘+ACK:GTDAT’or not

menu2.name: HUM (Humidity Alarm)
menu2.Description2: This command is used to set a humidity-alarm range for the terminal. According to the working mode, the terminal will report the event message HUM to the backend server when the humidity outside or inside the range is detected by the device.

menu3.Description: The ID of the Humidity alarm

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable the Alarm within the humidity range|2: Enable the Alarm Outside the humidity range|3: Enable the Alarm within or outside the humidity range, But Report only once|

menu3.Description: The ID of the Humidity sensor
When the Humidity sensor detects the environment Humidity meets the alarm condition, it will continuously check the Humidity this times
the device will report Humidity alarm every this times of Humidity reading

menu2.name: FVR (Configuration File Version Record)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTFVR is used to record information of the configuration file generated by Manage Tool for AT+GTUPC.

menu3.Description: The name of the configuration file
The version number of the configuration file
The parameter is used to confirm the validity of subsequent commands
The time when the configuration file is generated

menu2.name: UPC (Update Configuration)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTUPC command is used to download configuration file over the air for the update of the local configuration.

menu3.Description: It specifies the maximum number of retries to download the configuration file upon download failure
It specifies the expiration timeout of a single download
The protocol used to download the file. Only HTTP is supported now

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable.|
menu3.Description: A numeral which indicates whether to report the message +RESP:GTUPC or +RESP:GTEUC when the configuration is updated over the air
The time interval measured in hours for updating the configuration over the air
It specifies the URL to download the configuration file

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: A numeral which indicates the working mode of downloading configuration over the air

menu3.RangeMx: 0:UPC.|1:EUC |
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate the message to be reported for the configuration update status when <Enable Report> is 1
A numeral to identify the configuration update request

menu3.RangeMx: Ignition Off|Ignition On|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to configure the status in which the device can update the configuration

menu2.name: UPD(Firmware Update)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTUPD is used to start and stop the firmware update remotely.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Start the Firmware Update|1:Stop the Firmware Update|
0: HTTP.|
0: BB firmware update.|4: BLE firmware update.|5: CAN Module firmware update.|9: CAN Module configuration update.|
0:Report the +RESP:GTUPD message to indicate the firmware update status.|1:Report the +RESP:GTEUD message to indicate the firmware update status.|

menu2.name: RTO (Real Time Operation)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTRTO is used to retrieve information from the device or control the device when it executes certain actions.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:GNSS. Get the GNSS related information via the message +RESP:GTGPS|1:RTL. Request the terminal to report its current position immediately via the message +RESP: GTRTL|2:READ. Get the current configuration of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTALM|3:REBOOT. Reboot the terminal|4:RESET. Reset all parameters to factory settings|5:PWROFF. Power off the device|6:CID. Get the ICCID of the SIM card which is being used by the terminal via the message +RESP:GTCID|7:CSQ. Get the current GSM signal level of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTCSQ|8:VER. Get the version information of the device via the message +RESP:GTVER|9: Get the battery level and adapter status of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTBAT|A:IOS. Get status of all the IO ports via the message +RESP:GTIOS|B: TMZ. Get the time zone settings via the message +RESP:GTTMZ|C:GIR. Get cell information via the message +RESP:GTGSM|D: AIF. Get APN, ICCID, base station ID, RSSI, cell ID, IP and DNS server via the message +RESP:GTAIF|10:CAN. Get CAN information via the message +RESP:GTCAN|12:CVN. Get the version number information of CAN Module via the message +RESP:GTCVN|13:CSN. Get the serial number information of CAN100 via the message +RESP:GTCSN|14:BLE. Commands for Bluetooth|1C:ATI. Get basic device information via the message +RESP:GTATI|22:CAN Module Operation. Set car model for CAN Module or read car model from CAN Module|25:SCS. Get the self-calibration status of the acceleration data via the message +RESP:GTSCS or clear the self-calibration status|31:DELBUF. Delete all the buffered reports|3A:RLY. Set the state of the WRL300|3B: Query the GTINF.|
menu3.Description: It is used to retrieve information from unit or control the unit to execute certain actions

menu3.groupname: 0 - GNSS. Get the GNSS related information via the message +RESP:GTGPS.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The message will be output to the backend server.|1: The message will be output to the main serial port.|3: If the command is received via SMS, the message will be output to the original SMS number; otherwise the message will be output to the backend server.|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF)

menu3.groupname: 1 - RTL. Request the terminal to report its current position immediately via the message +RESP: GTRTL.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The message will be output to the backend server.|1: The message will be output to the main serial port.|3: If the command is received via SMS, the message will be output to the original SMS number; otherwise the message will be output to the backend server.|

menu3.groupname: 2 - READ. Get the current configuration of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTALM.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Do not add cutoff characters to the message +RESP:GTALM.|1: Add cutoff characters to the message +RESP:GTALM.|
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate the format of the +RESP:GTALM message.

menu3.groupname: 4 - RESET. Reset all parameters to factory settings.
6 - CID. Get the ICCID of the SIM card which is being used by the terminal via the message +RESP:GTCID.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The message will be output to the backend server.|1: The message will be output to the main serial port.|3: If the command is received via SMS, the message will be output to the original SMS number; otherwise the message will be output to the backend server.|

menu3.groupname: 7 - CSQ. Get the current GSM signal level of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTCSQ.
menu3.RangeMx: 0: The result will report by +RESP:GTCSQ.|1: The result will report by +RESP:GTESQ.

0: The message will be output to the backend server.|1: The message will be output to the main serial port.|3: If the command is received via SMS, the message will be output to the original SMS number; otherwise the message will be output to the backend server.|

menu3.groupname: 8 - VER. Get the version information of the device via the message +RESP:GTVER.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The message will be output to the backend server.|1: The message will be output to the main serial port.|3: If the command is received via SMS, the message will be output to the original SMS number; otherwise the message will be output to the backend server.|

menu3.groupname: 9 - BAT. Get the battery level and adapter status of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTBAT.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The message will be output to the backend server.|1: The message will be output to the main serial port.|3: If the command is received via SMS, the message will be output to the original SMS number; otherwise the message will be output to the backend server.|

menu3.groupname: A - IOS. Get status of all the IO ports via the message +RESP:GTIOS.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The message will be output to the backend server.|1: The message will be output to the main serial port.|3: If the command is received via SMS, the message will be output to the original SMS number; otherwise the message will be output to the backend server.|

menu3.groupname: B - TMZ. Get the time zone settings via the message +RESP:GTTMZ.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The message will be output to the backend server.|1: The message will be output to the main serial port.|3: If the command is received via SMS, the message will be output to the original SMS number; otherwise the message will be output to the backend server.|

menu3.groupname: C - GIR. Get cell information via the message +RESP:GTGSM.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The message will be output to the backend server.|1: The message will be output to the main serial port.|3: If the command is received via SMS, the message will be output to the original SMS number; otherwise the message will be output to the backend server.|

menu3.groupname: D - AIF. Get APN, ICCID, base station ID, RSSI, cell ID, IP and DNS server via the message +RESP:GTAIF.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The message will be output to the backend server.|1: The message will be output to the main serial port.|3: If the command is received via SMS, the message will be output to the original SMS number; otherwise the message will be output to the backend server.|

menu3.groupname: 10 - CAN. Get CAN information via the message +RESP:GTCAN

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The message will be output to the backend server.|1: The message will be output to the main serial port.|3: If the command is received via SMS, the message will be output to the original SMS number; otherwise the message will be output to the backend server.|

menu3.groupname: 12 - CVN. Get the version number information of CAN Module via the message +RESP:GTCVN

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The message will be output to the backend server.|1: The message will be output to the main serial port.|3: If the command is received via SMS, the message will be output to the original SMS number; otherwise the message will be output to the backend server.|

menu3.groupname: 13 - CSN. Get the serial number information of CAN100 via the message +RESP:GTCSN. It works only when the <Accessory Type> of AT+GTBAS is 4 and the <Accessory Model> is 0. The <Mode> of AT+GTCAN also needs to be set to 1.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The message will be output to the backend server.|1: The message will be output to the main serial port.|3: If the command is received via SMS, the message will be output to the original SMS number; otherwise the message will be output to the backend server.|

0: The message will be output to the backend server.|1: The message will be output to the main serial port.|3: If the command is received via SMS, the message will be output to the original SMS number; otherwise the message will be output to the backend server.|

menu2.name: RTP (Remote File Transfer)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTRTP is used to obtain files from the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Download File|
menu3.Description: Set the working mode of file transfer

menu3.RangeMx: 0: HTTP|
menu3.Description: The type of communication protocol used to obtain data from the background server

menu3.RangeMx: 0: CA certificate.|1: Client Certificate|2: Client key|
menu3.Description: Write the data obtained by the server to the local file Type

menu2.name: LTP (Local File Transfer)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTLTP is used to write the file to the device by subcontracting.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Delete File|1:Write file|
menu3.Description: Set the working mode of the file

menu3.RangeMx: 0: CA certificate|1: Client Certificate|2: Client key|
menu3.Description: Write the data obtained to the local file Type
The location where the current data is written to the file
Total serial number of write file data
Data written to file
CRC verification data of <Data> is used to determine whether the data is correct

menu2.name: LBC (SMS Location Request)
menu2.Description2: This command can only be sent via SMS. The device will send SMS report with Google maps hyperlink and the current location to corresponding phone number or report LBC to the backend server immediately.
